page.title: 10Orton Longueville changes.
page.content: Orton Longueville has changed greatly over the last 100 years. Almost all the houses were in The Village, Botolph lane and along Oundle road. The Royston Avenue/Oakleigh Drive housing estate dates from the 1960's. Botolph lane and Mogswell Lane are the only 2 roads which are still made up of hardcore with no tar on them. All the village roads would have been like this. In the big house on Oundle road 30 years ago the children from the village school used to have a fete in the garden and country dance. If they pleased the owner she would throw sweets down to them from an upstairs window. At that time the houses on Botolph lane were mainly thatched, but now all have tiled roofs, the only thatch being along The Village. The school has moved from The village to Oundle Rd.
